body:
### Problem

Can consistently cause NeoVim to crash when just typing in insert mode, seemingly due to large completions list.
When LSP is disabled the crash does not occur, which is why I think it has something to do with the new NeoVim LSP capabilities.
I am not using omnifunc or anything at time of crash, nothing that I am doing is me interacting with the LS, it is something in the background.

```terraform

  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[  #<-- Typed up to here with no issues
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[" #<-- Crashed!
``` 

I don't believe it to be a Terraform specific issue for a few reasons:
- The exact same LS and test case works in VsCode without issue.
- The nvim process is the one using 100% CPU, I suspect it is a generic issue that just surfaces easily when using Terraform.
- It does not crash on every `[ ` in Terraform, it seems to only happen when I would expect the LS to be returning lots of information (All of the parameters of a resource for instance, which gets noisy quick).
  - Where it does crash it does so 100% consistently, just like it seems to work 100% consistent without issues in other places.

Apologies for not being able to offer more information up front, I am not a developer myself and my rudimentary stack traces revealed nothing, but I don't know if that is just me not knowing how to do that correctly.




### Steps to reproduce using "nvim -u minimal_init.lua"

1. Install Terraform LS

```bash
brew install terraform-ls`
```

2. Create `init.lua`

```lua
vim.lsp.config['tf'] = {
  -- Command and arguments to start the server.
  cmd = { "terraform-ls", "serve" },
  -- Filetypes to automatically attach to.
  filetypes = { 'terraform', 'terraform-vars' },
  -- Sets the "workspace" to the directory where any of these files is found.
  -- Files that share a root directory will reuse the LSP server connection.
  -- Nested lists indicate equal priority, see |vim.lsp.Config|.
  root_markers = { '.git' },
  -- Specific settings to send to the server. The schema is server-defined.
  -- Example: https://raw.githubusercontent.com/LuaLS/vscode-lua/master/setting/schema.json
  settings = {
  }
}
vim.lsp.enable('tf')
vim.lsp.set_log_level("debug")
```

3. Create `main.tf`

```hcl
terraform {}

module "management" {
  source  = "Azure/avm-ptn-alz-management/azurerm"
  version = "0.6.0" # change this to your desired version, https://www.terraform.io/language/expressions/version-constraints
}

output "broken" {
  description = "Adding a double quote or a number after the [ on line 34 causes cpu to go to 100% and indefinitely hangs nvim"
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[
}
```

4. Attempt to edit line 10 in `main.tf`

a.
```bash
nvim -u init.lua main.tf
```

b. Move to line 10, and try to add a " or number

``` hcl
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[ 
  value       = module.management.log_analytics_workspace[" <-- Crash!
```



### Expected behavior

_No response_

### Nvim version (nvim -v)

NVIM v0.12.0-dev-1471+g be73c35943 Homebrew Build type: Release LuaJIT 2.1.1760617492

### Language server name/version

terraformls 0.38.2

### Operating system/version

Ubuntu 22.04.5 LTS (WSL)

### Log file

https://gist.github.com/ryan-royals/a8b6fe979ec5db759dcc166da5a93dcd

comment_data.body:
I'm facing exactly the same issue on macos. What is also interesting is that if I kill the underlying terraform-ls process nvim is still frozen and uses 100% cpu.

You can also reproduce the issue using this example:
```
resource "aws_iam_policy" "this" {
  name   = "example"
}
```

Go below name and add `policy = <<EOF`

Temporarily disabling semantic tokens won’t cause a hang.

```lua
vim.api.nvim_create_autocmd('LspAttach', {
  callback = function(args)
    local client = vim.lsp.get_client_by_id(args.data.client_id)
    if client and client.server_capabilities then
      client.server_capabilities.semanticTokensProvider = nil
    end
  end,
})
```

seems like terraform-ls returned an invalid token length `4294967295`, causing the while loop to never exit in semantic_tokens.lua

```
[ERROR][2025-11-01 16:45:57] ...ovim/HEAD-b92b95e/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua:151	"rpc"	"terraform-ls"	"stderr"	'2025/11/01 16:45:57 rpc_logger.go:53: Response to "textDocument/semanticTokens/full" (ID 3): {"data":[0,0,9,7,0,2,0,6,7,0,0,7,12,0,0,1,2,6,5,1,0,10,38,6,0,1,2,7,5,0,0,10,7,6,0,3,0,6,7,0,0,7,8,0,0,1,2,11,5,0,0,14,111,6,0,1,2,5,5,0,0,14,6,8,0,0,7,10,8,0,0,11,23,8,0,0,58,59,3,0,1,0,1,3,0,1,0,4294967295,3,0]}\n2025/11/01 16:45:57 opts.go:215: Completed 1 requests [766.875µs elapsed]\n'
[DEBUG][2025-11-01 16:45:57] ...ovim/HEAD-b92b95e/share/nvim/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/log.lua:151	"rpc.receive"	{ id = 3, jsonrpc = "2.0", result = { data = { 0, 0, 9, 7, 0, 2, 0, 6, 7, 0, 0, 7, 12, 0, 0, 1, 2, 6, 5, 1, 0, 10, 38, 6, 0, 1, 2, 7, 5, 0, 0, 10, 7, 6, 0, 3, 0, 6, 7, 0, 0, 7, 8, 0, 0, 1, 2, 11, 5, 0, 0, 14, 111, 6, 0, 1, 2, 5, 5, 0, 0, 14, 6, 8, 0, 0, 7, 10, 8, 0, 0, 11, 23, 8, 0, 0, 58, 59, 3, 0, 1, 0, 1, 3, 0, 1, 0, 4294967295, 3, 0 } } }
````
A defensive approach.

```diff
diff --git a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/semantic_tokens.lua b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/semantic_tokens.lua
index 3bd703785a..05705d2da8 100644
--- a/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/semantic_tokens.lua
+++ b/runtime/lua/vim/lsp/semantic_tokens.lua
@@ -130,7 +130,7 @@ local function tokens_to_ranges(data, bufnr, client, request)
       ---@type integer LuaLS bug, type must be marked explicitly here
       local new_end_char = end_char - vim.str_utfindex(buf_line, encoding) - eol_offset
       -- While end_char goes past the given line, extend the token range to the next line
-      while new_end_char > 0 do
+      while new_end_char > 0 and end_line < #lines - 1 do
         end_char = new_end_char
         end_line = end_line + 1
         buf_line = lines[end_line + 1] or ''
```

@glepnir How did you enable such logs?

I've tried `LspLogs` but I'm unable to find any information related to semantic token and especially not the answer with the `result.data` field.

I have a similar issue: since semantic token is enabled, nvim sometime hang for minutes, using 100% cpu. However it does not crash and after a few minutes, the editor is usable again (hence not "infinite hang"). I have only experimented such problem with haskell-language-server LSP, but that's the LSP I'm using most of my time. I'm however not able to come with a robust repro like the one depicted here, so I cannot confirm that this is the same problem.

When my nvim is stuck, the lsp server do not use any CPU. `perf record` shows:

```
   8.51%  nvim             nvim                             [.] nlua_str_utfindex                                                                                                              ◆
   8.29%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x000000000000da85                                                                                                             ▒
   3.19%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] lua_type                                                                                                                       ▒
   3.17%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] luaL_checklstring                                                                                                              ▒
   3.07%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x000000000000da91                                                                                                             ▒
   2.45%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] luaL_checkinteger                                                                                                              ▒
   2.36%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] lua_pushnil                                                                                                                    ▒
   2.31%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x000000000000da95                                                                                                             ▒
   2.03%  nvim             [JIT] tid 3550520                [.] 0x00007f09f3ac9464                                                                                                             ▒
   1.68%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x0000000000013fe2                                                                                                             ▒
   1.50%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x0000000000013fc2                                                                                                             ▒
   1.31%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x0000000000013fde                                                                                                             ▒
   1.28%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x0000000000013f55                                                                                                             ▒
   1.21%  nvim             [JIT] tid 3550520                [.] 0x00007f09f3ac9489                                                                                                             ▒
   1.17%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] 0x0000000000013fca                                                                                                             ▒
   1.13%  nvim             [JIT] tid 3550520                [.] 0x00007f09f3ac9485                                                                                                             ▒
   1.13%  nvim             libluajit-5.1.so.2.1.1741730670  [.] lua_pushinteger                                               
```

(only lines with >1%). `nlua_str_utfindex` seems involved.

@glepnir your "defensive" fix is updating the following loop:

```lua
      while new_end_char > 0 do
        end_char = new_end_char
        end_line = end_line + 1
        buf_line = lines[end_line + 1] or ''
        new_end_char = new_end_char - vim.str_utfindex(buf_line, encoding) - eol_offset
      end
```

which indeed contains a call to `str_utfindex`, so it seems that our issues are completely related.

I will try to investigate and report a bug in the lsp I care about, but having the "defensive" fix merged could help I suppose.

> [@glepnir](https://github.com/glepnir) How did you enable such logs?

Try `vim.lsp.log.set_level('debug')` and `:che vim.lsp`.
Applying @glepnir's work around fixes the issue here.

title: LSP: Infinite Hang + 100% CPU on typing in Insert Mode
